bill.title: Student Data; Computer Services; Information Protection
bill.description: Limits the ways in which the operator of a website, online service, online application, or mobile application working with the Department of Education can use student data. (SB2607 HD2)

history.action: Introduced.
Passed First Reading.
Referred to EDU/EET, JDL.
The committee(s) on EDU/EET has scheduled a public hearing on 02-05-16 1:00PM in conference room 229.
The committee(s) on EDU deferred the measure until 02-10-16 1:15PM in conference room 229.
The committee(s) on EET deferred the measure until 02-10-16 1:15PM in conference room 414.

The committee(s) on EDU recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in EDU were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Kidani, Chun Oakland, Dela Cruz, Riviere; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Harimoto, Slom.
The committee on EET deferred the measure.
The committee(s) on EET will hold a public decision making on 02-17-16 1:20PM in conference room 414.

The committee(s) on EET recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in EET were as follows: 6 Aye(s): Senator(s) Wakai, Slom, Baker, Galuteria, Ihara, L. Thielen; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Espero, Keith-Agaran, Ruderman.
Reported from EDU/EET (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2410) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 02-25-16 9:01AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, K.Kahele, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Gabbard, Kim, L. Thielen.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2580) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 03-08-16.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Riviere). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 208) in amended form (SD 2).
Pass First Reading
Referred to EDN, CPC, JUD, referral sheet 26
Bill scheduled to be heard by EDN on Wednesday, 03-16-16 2:00PM in House conference room 309.

The committees on EDN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 9 Ayes: Representative(s) Takumi, Ohno, Choy, Ichiyama, Ing, Ito, Say, Tsuji, Matsumoto; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Aquino, Kong, Tupola.
Reported from EDN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1083-16), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to CPC.
Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Cachola, Kawakami, Kong, Tokioka excused (4).
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Monday, 03-21-16 3:00PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 03-23-16 at 2:00 PM.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Wednesday, 03-23-16 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 14 Ayes: Representative(s) McKelvey, Woodson, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Har, Hashem, C. Lee, Nakashima, San Buenaventura, Takayama, Yamane, Fukumoto Chang, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Kawakami, Oshiro.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1311-16) as amended in HD 1, recommending referral to JUD.

Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on JUD as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Kawakami, Kong, Oshiro, Tokioka, Tupola, Woodson excused (6).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 03-29-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, Kawakami, Morikawa, Nakashima, Takayama, Woodson; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, C. Lee, McDermott, Thielen.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1446-16) as amended in HD 2, recommending passage on Third Reading.
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Wednesday, 04-06-16.
Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Rhoads, Thielen excused (2). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 390).
Deferred until 04-08-16.
Deferred until 04-12-16.
Deferred until 04-14-16.
Senate agrees with House amendments. Placed on the calendar for Final Reading on 04-15-16.

Passed Final Reading. 20 Aye(s); Aye(s) with reservations: none . 0 No(es): none. 5 Excused: Senator(s) English, Harimoto, Keith-Agaran, Slom, L. Thielen.
Received notice of Senate agreement and Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 650).
House Conferees Appointed: Takumi, McKelvey, Rhoads Co-Chairs; Ohno, Say, Matsumoto.

House conferee(s) discharged: Representative(s) Say.
Received notice of change in conferees (Hse. Com. No. 621).
Enrolled to Governor.
